Talon:

"WHAT THE PIT IS GOING HERE????" Cursed Talon, in a minion way, whi=
le she followed guardia and Lord Perseus







From: Kraftlos 
Sent: Tuesd=
ay, April 21, 2009 6:08 PM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Subject: The Crash L=
anding and Aftermath






The engines had been losing power for the last d=
ay and a half; but finally the gigantic craft could no longer fight the for=
ces that pulled on it and its orbit began to decay.  Knowing that their onl=
y hope of survival was to safely crash land, the pilot picked an open area =
of ocean and tried to approach at a safe angle to slow itself enough to kee=
p the ship intact.

Lord Perseus and his crew walked along the bridge that =
crossed the gap between the part of the island where the hangers were locat=
ed and the peninsula area where the base sat.  Suddenly the sky became dark=
 and a rumbling noise could be heard, growing louder and louder.  He looked=
 up to see almost the whole sky occupied by a massive starship seemly headi=
ng straight for the island.  The Atlantis emergency alarm started to sound =
and civilians rushed to their shelters.

"Everyone!  To the base!  Hurry!" =
ordered Perseus breaking out into a run.

The rumbling sound continued to g=
et louder.  As Perseus and his crew reached the base door, it was quickly o=
pened for them then shut behind them.  He ordered everyone to move the lowe=
r level of the base.  As the ship passed over the island, the sound grew so=
 loud that the ground shook and weaker parts of buildings started to crumbl=
e, as in an earthquake.  The ship traveled for another three miles before i=
t touched down in the deep ocean waters.  The force of the impact sent the =
ship hundreds of feet below the surface and it continued to sink until comi=
ng to rest on the top of an underwater mountain.  The mass of water displac=
ed by the ship started a massive tsunami-like wave, going out in all direct=
ions.

The ground began to shake again and the lights flickered inside the =
Maximal base.

"Sir, what's that noise?" Guardia asked, sealing the last he=
avy door to the underground section of the base.

The lights continued to f=
licker, then went out.

At that moment the ten-story-high wall of water str=
uck Atlantis from the east, picking up all the boats in the harbor and toss=
ing them onto the land.  The parts of the docks that were not made of concr=
ete were pushed up and destroyed.  A moment later the water hit the buildin=
gs in the lower wharf area and they immediately collapsed under the intense=
 weight of water.  Likewise the metal dome that made up the upper story of =
the Maximal base was immediately ripped from its foundations and carried aw=
ay, along with everything in the command center, the armory, mess hall, and=
 the main bank of CR chambers were also picked up and carried away.

The lo=
wer floor of the base had a large metal slab to protect it from bombing, an=
d as the water continued to pour over it, everything on the upper floors wa=
s ripped away, leaving a clean plate of metal sitting at the bottom of the =
crater that was the base.  The buildings along the center of the town were =
a little sturdier and remained standing, though heavily damaged.  The hange=
r and all the craft in it were picked up and thrown into the ocean.

As the=
 water came to tower it filled up the deep trench around the structure then=
 the wall hit it, wrapping it entirely except for the top five stories, dam=
aging supports, breaking out all the windows and destroying the bridges tha=
t allowed access to the tower.  The wave then continued across the rest of =
the island, destroying buildings and carrying away the mass of debris, and =
then all was eerily quiet.
